publicClasses.brief: The class error_category serves as a base class for types used to identify the source and encoding of a particular category of error code. Classes may be derived from error_category to support categories of errors in addition to those defined in the C++ International Standard.
publicClasses.name: thrust::system::error_category
publicClasses.summary: The class error_category serves as a base class for types used to identify the source and encoding of a particular category of error code. Classes may be derived from error_category to support categories of errors in addition to those defined in the C++ International Standard.
publicClasses.title: thrust::system::error_category

publicClasses.brief: The class error_code describes an object used to hold error code values, such as those originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
publicClasses.name: thrust::system::error_code
publicClasses.summary: The class error_code describes an object used to hold error code values, such as those originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
publicClasses.title: thrust::system::error_code

publicClasses.brief: The class error_condition describes an object used to hold values identifying error conditions.
publicClasses.name: thrust::system::error_condition
publicClasses.summary: The class error_condition describes an object used to hold values identifying error conditions.
publicClasses.title: thrust::system::error_condition

publicClasses.brief: The class system_error describes an exception object used to report error conditions that have an associated error_code. Such error conditions typically originate from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
publicClasses.name: thrust::system::system_error
publicClasses.summary: The class system_error describes an exception object used to report error conditions that have an associated error_code. Such error conditions typically originate from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces.
publicClasses.title: thrust::system::system_error

publicFunctions.name: generic_category
note: The object's default_error_condition and equivalent virtual functions shall behave as specified for the class error_category. The object's name virtual function shall return a pointer to the string "generic".
returns: A reference to an object of a type derived from class error_category.
publicFunctions.title: generic_category

publicFunctions.details: If the argument ev corresponds to a POSIX errno value posv, the function shall return error_condition(ev,generic_category()). Otherwise, the function shall return error_condition(ev,system_category()). What constitutes correspondence for any given operating system is unspecified.
publicFunctions.name: system_category
note: The object's equivalent virtual functions shall behave as specified for class error_category. The object's name virtual function shall return a pointer to the string "system". The object's default_error_condition virtual function shall behave as follows:
returns: A reference to an object of a type derived from class error_category.
publicFunctions.title: system_category

publicFunctions.details: Returns an object encoding the error.
publicFunctions.name: code

publicFunctions.details: Returns a human-readable string indicating the nature of the error.
publicFunctions.name: what
returns: a string incorporating code().message() and the arguments supplied in the constructor.
